properties.name: ACT Theatre
properties.description: Contemporary theater committed to local playwrights with a young playwrights program.

properties.name: Ada's Technical Books & Cafe
properties.description: Seattle's technical bookstore and cafe.

properties.name: Bagley Wright Lecture Series on Poetry
properties.description: Event series that explores poets’ own thinking on poetry and poetics.

properties.name: Bushwick Book Club
properties.description: Musical nonprofit that celebrates literature by creating original music inspired by books and teaching songwriting to youth.

properties.name: Cadence Video Poetry Festival
properties.description: Festival that approaches video poetry as a literary genre that makes new meaning from the combination of text and moving image.

properties.name: Cascadia Poetry Festival
properties.description: An annual community-driven event that blends the art of poetry & storytelling with ecology and environmental activism.

properties.name: Central District Forum for Arts & Ideas
properties.description: Presents emerging Black arts, artists, and ideas in the Seattle area.

properties.name: Clarion West Writers Workshop
properties.description: Long-running workshop and event series specializing in speculative fiction.

properties.name: Duwamish Longhouse and Cultural Center
properties.address: 4705 W Marginal Way SW, Seattle, WA 98106
properties.description: Community center promoting the social, cultural, and economic survival of Seattle’s Duwamish Tribe.

properties.name: Eagle Harbor Book Co.
properties.address: 157 Winslow Way E., Bainbridge Island, WA 98110
properties.description: Independent bookstore serving Bainbridge Island since 1970.

properties.name: El Centro de la Raza
properties.description: Latinx-rooted community cultural center co-founded by Roberto Maestas, a member of Seattle’s influential “Gang of Four” along with Bernie Whitebear, Bob Santos, and Larry Gossett.

properties.name: Elliott Bay Book Company
properties.description: Full-service bookstore and community space hosting frequent readings.

properties.name: Emerald City Writers' Conference
properties.description: The largest romance writing conference on the West Coast, presented by Emerald City Romance Writers.

properties.name: Estelita's Library
properties.description: Social justice community library and online bookstore.

properties.name: Hugo House
properties.description: Nonprofit literary center offering writing classes, workshops, and other programs, as well as literary reading series and fellowships.

properties.name: It's About Time Writers' Reading Series
properties.description: Seattle’s longest-running prose and poetry reading series open to anyone in the community.

properties.name: Lit Fix
properties.description: Quarterly reading and music series.

properties.name: Jack Straw Cultural Center
properties.description: Multidisciplinary audio arts center with an annual writers program.

properties.name: Langston Seattle
properties.description: Arts organization centering Black artists, writers, and audiences, based in a cultural center named in honor of the famed Harlem Renaissance writer.

properties.name: Loving Room: diaspora books + salon
properties.description: Black-owned community reading room featuring literature by Black + African writers for readers of all ages.

properties.name: Madison Books
properties.description: Nationally recognized independent bookstore serving Madison Park.

properties.name: Magnolia's Bookstore
properties.description: Independent general bookstore serving Magnolia.

properties.name: Margin Shift: Friends in Poetry
properties.description: Poetry collective that highlights poets of color, LGBTQI poets, experimental, and brand new writers.

properties.name: Nepantla Cultural Arts Gallery
properties.description: Community arts hub grounded in Chicana/o Latinx arts traditions.

properties.name: Northwest African American Museum
properties.description: Museum that celebrates and honors the history of African Americans in the Northwest.

properties.name: Noveltease Theatre
properties.description: Literary burlesque theater company that adapts classic works to reclaim and rework the canon from a sex-positive, queer, feminist, and anti-racist standpoint.

properties.name: Open Books
properties.description: Poetry-only bookstore featuring new, rare, and out-of-print books, chapbooks, journals, and more.

properties.name: Paper Boat Booksellers
properties.description: Family-owned, independent bookstore.

properties.name: Partners in Print
properties.description: Nonprofit that uses letterpress printing to amplify new voices and spark creativity.

properties.name: Phinney Books
properties.description: Neighborhood bookstore offering new books, paper goods, and puzzles.

properties.name: Queen Anne Book Company
properties.address: 1811 Queen Anne Ave N, Seattle, WA 98109

properties.name: Seattle Antiquarian Book Fair
properties.description: Annual antiquarian and rare book fair that features thousands of collectible books, ephemera, manuscripts, and more.

properties.name: Seattle Art Book Fair
properties.description: Annual festival that celebrates independent publishing, book design, and books-as-art.

properties.name: Seattle Arts & Lectures
properties.description: Organization that celebrates language through a Writers in the Schools program and high-profile literary events.

properties.name: Seattle Independent Bookstore Day
properties.description: Day-long celebration of indie bookstores that takes place annually on the last Saturday of April.

properties.name: Seattle Urban Book Expo
properties.description: Literary nonprofit that helps create, cultivate, and connect self-published authors of color through events and an annual book fair.

properties.name: Seattle Public Library (SPL), Central Library
properties.description: Opened in 1891 as a single reading room in Pioneer Square, the City’s public library system now includes 27 locations including the iconic Central branch, designed by Rem Koolhaas and Joshua Prince-Ramus.

properties.name: Secret Garden Books
properties.description: Full-service, general bookstore since 1977 specializing in children's books.

properties.name: Short Run Comix and Arts
properties.description: Literary nonprofit that hosts an annual comix festival, residency program, and educational workshops.

properties.name: Tasveer South Asian Litfest
properties.description: Annual festival that brings together an eclectic group of South Asian writers to discuss the issues that shape the lives of the South Asian diaspora.

properties.description: General-interest bookstore with three locations, featuring new and used books.

properties.description: General-interest bookstore with three locations, featuring new and used books.
